remarks.para: This converter can only convert a single-precision, floating point number object to and from a string. The value type represents a single-precision 32-bit number with values ranging from negative 3.402823e38 to positive 3.402823e38.

block.para: You should never create an instance of . Instead, call the method of . For more information, see the examples in the base class and How to: Implement a Type Converter.

summary.para: Provides a type converter to convert single-precision, floating point number objects to and from various other representations.
